name: Perphenazine (Trilafon)
summary: Perphenazine, sold under the brand name Trilafon, is a typical antipsychotic medication used primarily to treat schizophrenia and severe nausea and vomiting.
description: Perphenazine is a mid-potency typical antipsychotic in the phenothiazine class. It is effective for controlling symptoms of schizophrenia, schizoaffective disorder, and other psychoses. It works mainly as a dopamine D2 receptor antagonist in the central nervous system, reducing positive psychotic symptoms such as hallucinations and delusions. Perphenazine is also used for controlling severe nausea and vomiting. Its mid-potency profile gives it a balance between sedation and extrapyramidal side effect risks compared to low- and high-potency phenothiazines.

contraindications: Comatose states or severe CNS depression

items: Control of severe nausea and vomiting

sections.text: Perphenazine primarily blocks dopamine D2 receptors in the mesolimbic pathway, reducing psychotic symptoms. It also has antihistaminic and anticholinergic properties, contributing to sedation and other side effects.

adult.Schizophrenia: Typical oral dose: 8–16 mg/day in divided doses; severe cases may require up to 64 mg/day.

sections.geriatric: Lower starting dose recommended; monitor closely for side effects.

sections.text: Onset of antipsychotic effects may take several days to weeks; antiemetic effects occur within hours.

sections.black_box: Increased mortality in elderly patients with dementia-related psychosis.
other: Risk of tardive dyskinesia with long-term use
Caution in patients with cardiovascular disease
Caution in patients with seizure disorders

sections.pregnancy: Use only if benefits outweigh risks; phenothiazines cross the placenta.
sections.lactation: Excreted in breast milk; use caution.
sections.geriatrics: Increased risk of sedation, falls, and extrapyramidal symptoms.

sections.text: Gradual dose reduction recommended to avoid withdrawal symptoms or relapse.

items: Mid-potency phenothiazine with balanced side effect and efficacy profile.
Monitor for both anticholinergic and extrapyramidal effects.
